intro: Helmia dumetorum, commonly known as the common helmiopsis, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink or reddish flowers. The plant typically has oval-shaped leaves with serrated edges and often grows in moist, shaded environments. It is known for its ability to thrive in rocky or disturbed soils. Helmia dumetorum is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
